result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Lehan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry for 10 Years. Not to have any sexually explicit things on his current cell phone and he is subject to random checks on all electonic devices by his agent. Phone from this incident to be destroyed. 
Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. To Commence 08/11/17 by 5pm.

Defendant David W Lehan in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing. Jill L. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Phone from this incident to be destroyed
____Sex offender registry for 10 years 
____Not to have any sexually explicit things on his current cell phone and he is subject to random checks on all electronic devices by his agent 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

FINE:  $1,538.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500.00) and remainder is to be refunded to poster)

CONDITION TIME:  12 Months, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence August 11, 2017 by 5:00 p.m. 

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
Sentencing hearing on July 28, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David W Lehan in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  State withdraws motion it filed 5/19/17.   Defendant enters an alford no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State and Attorney Kershek request a sentencing date.  Court adjourns for sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David W Lehan in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for oral ruling.  State realizes that they need to file an amended information.  Court rules that defense is not precluded from bringing up 3rd party suspect at trial, but will not allow improper character evidence.  State states there has been nothing new as far as discovery on case since January, 2017.  State requests a copy of defense's forensic expert's report.  Case is left on for jury status and jury trial.

Defendant David W Lehan in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion hearing.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding motion to dismiss.  State makes statements regarding Attorney Kershek's statements.  Court denies motion to dismiss.  Court addresses motion in limine regarding in camera inspection.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding motion in limine.  State gives statements/responses to Attorney Kershek's statements.  Rebuttal statements made by Attorney Kershek.  Court will not allow allegations regarding 3rd party mentioned to be brought up at trial.  Attorney Kershek makes additional statements, may be filing a motion for reconsideration.  State states they are requesting an adjournment of the July 19, 2016 trial date.  Attorney Kershek states that he just received some additional discovery from the state.  Attorney Kershek is in agreement with state's adjournment request.  Court reschedules jury status and jury trial.  Previous dates are cancelled.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
